name: Hotel Room 204 - The Fawlty
description: This room bears the hallmarks of someone who's very nearly competent at maintenance. The wallpaper was hung upside-down, creating an inverted forest where trees grow from ceiling to floor like stalactites of vegetation. One leg of the bed is slightly shorter than the others, compensated for by a strategic placement of folded cardboard that's actually quite clever. The bathroom door doesn't quite latch unless you lift it slightly while closing, a quirk that becomes second nature after the third attempt. It's the kind of room that makes you appreciate the triumph of 'good enough.'

features.wallpaper: An upside-down forest where birds fly into the ground and roots dangle from the sky. Surprisingly meditative once you accept it.
features.bed: Three normal legs and one with a creative cardboard solution. Sleeps level. Mostly level. Acceptably level.
features.door: Requires the lift-and-turn technique. Previous guests have left encouraging notes in pencil on the door frame: 'Lift!' 'UP!' 'You'll get it!'
features.maintenance: Evidence of repairs done with enthusiasm if not expertise. The toilet handle is tied to the flush mechanism with what appears to be a shoelace. It works.
